title: How Do Bacteria Respond to Nanostructured Features of the Brass Substrate?
content: Lead-free brasses are gradually replacing lead-containing brasses. However, little is known about their microstructure evolution during severe plastic deformation (SPD). SPD techniques due to the generation and rearrangement of defects produce nanostructures of unprecedented properties, e.g., high strength [1]. In this study, the aim was to investigate the impact of the microstructure refinement in lead-free brass by SPD on its antibacterial properties. It has been proved that microstructure refinement in the case of copper led to a significant improvement in its antibacterial properties [2].
